posts.content:
Hopefully this is a quickie, and I've just missed something.

How does the extra attack at full AB granted by DP impact on the Monk attack progression when using either fist or kama, if at all?

I ask because, yes, I'm having a serious mull about combining the two classes (without using Monk as cheese) in a meaningful way (meaningful in my terms, that is). Also because, assuming a pre-epic BAB of no more than 15 (equating to 3 APR), Monk UBAB progression means you'll still get more than 3 APR pre-epic. So...?

Confused cheers

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Most of the time you should aim for 15 BAB. Effectively you end up with -1 AB on all attacks but your lowest AB attack gets a boost.
Focusing purely on BAB and the Flurry AB penalty (ignoring STR/DEX/Feats/AB bonuses/etc) you have the following AB progressions.

15 BAB + Monk APR: +15/+12/+9/+6/+3
15 BAB + Monk APR + Divine Power: +15/+12/+9/+6/+3/+15
16 BAB + Monk APR: +16/+13/+10/+7/+4/+1

15 BAB + Monk APR + Divine Power + Flurry: +13/+10/+7/+4/+1/+13/+8
16 BAB + Monk APR + Flurry: +14/+11/+8/+5/+2/-1/+14

15 BAB + Monk APR + Divine Power + Haste: +15/+12/+9/+6/+3/+15/+10
16 BAB + Monk APR + Haste:  +16/+13/+10/+7/+4/+1/+16

15 BAB + Monk APR + Divine Power + Flurry + Haste: +13/+10/+7/+4/+1/+13/+8/+3
16 BAB + Monk APR + Flurry + Haste: +14/+11/+8/+5/+2/-1/+14/+9

Hey Stag!

As the "self-proclaimed" expert on Cleric / Monks, allow me to pitch in.

Yunim provided the numbers, which might work for some. For me, I provide the logic of how it works. All regular attacks are done at Monk Ubab protection normally (you'll just gain 5 or more AB on each of them), so take a regular monk progression and add 5 (or rather, the difference between your character's pre-epic BAB and 20, and you'll have the new attack schedule). You should NEVER EVER EVER (as Yunim demonstrated) aim for a BAB 16 or more on a Cleric, as I've already emphasized in my guide.

The EXTRA attack provided by Divine Power will be dealt with separately, as well as extra attacks from other sources (Haste, Flurry of Blows, etc..). Each of the new extra attacks will come at -5 from each other, not following UBAB progression. 

Let's take my Magical Master, for example. Fully buffed at level 40, you should have 61 AB, 59 with FoB active.

His Attack Schedule with Haste, FoB and Divine Power will be:

Regular: 59/56/53/50/47 + Extra: 59/54/49 (extra attacks from DP, Haste and FoB respectively)

I hope this clarifies how it works.

As for the build you're trying to reach, the DEX version I have already made. Please look at Bigby's Small Hand Complex for inspiration / reference.

Cheers!
